entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, mentioned as playing chess with Seamus Finnigan and receiving presents on Christmas Eve.

entities.name: seamus finnigan
entities.description: A friend of Harry's who lent him chessmen to play with.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Harry's friend, mentioned as waking up on Christmas morning and receiving presents.

relationships.description: Seamus Finnigan lent chessmen to Harry, which is mentioned in the text as 'Harry played with chessmen Seamus Finnigan had lent him'.
Harry received presents from Ron on Christmas morning, as mentioned in the text as 'Will you look at this? I've got some presents!'
Ron gave presents to Harry on Christmas morning, which is implied by the text as Ron's pile of presents being bigger than Harry's.
